Understate: The claim may understate the impact of Governor Kemp's order on small businesses by not fully acknowledging the hardships faced by restaurant owners.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough support to fully prove that Governor Kemp mandated restaurants to reopen, as it is stated that restaurants are allowed to reopen but not required to.
Problematic assumption: The claim may make the problematic assumption that all restaurants will be able to feasibly reopen under the 39 conditions set by Governor Kemp, without considering the size and limitations of different establishments.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the hardships faced by restaurant owners, such as the impact of private contractual arrangements for unemployment insurance and rent, which are difficult to fact-check.
